text:
80yo Portugese speaking female S/P recent hospitalization at [**Hospital1 3633**] with
   CP -> cath lab where she was found to have 3VD (including 95% LM): No
   intervention and surgery declined her as she was too high risk. She was
   DC
d to home and suffered a  reoccurrence of chest pain 2 days later ->
   ruled in at [**Hospital3 2794**] for STEMI ( Inferior MI). Peak cpk 1350.
   Transferred to [**Hospital1 19**] for re-evalulation of CABG.  Pt admitted on
   heparin and ntg, NTG weaned off [**7-29**], remains on heparin. Cardiac
   Surgery came by to see pt and now have cardiac cath films from [**Hospital1 3633**] as
   of [**7-30**]; CSurg waiting to determine her candidacy is c/b ARF and HCV
   cirrhosis.
   Temp pacing wire inserted [**7-30**] for bradycardia 28-30 Afib s/p inferior
   MI.
   [**8-2**]; pacer rate increased and patent started both IV Lasix gtt and
   diuril as having increasing O2 requirements (on non-rebreather) and
   worsening edema.
    Has experienced some confusion over past few days but cooperative w/
   care. Alert and oriented x [**2-16**].  Supportive dtrs have been staying with
   patient overnight given confusion and language barrier.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Urine output conts to be low.  Ordered for a 250cc NS bolus but CVP
   20-24.  Bp trending down to the mid to low 80
s.  O2 sats drifting down
   to mid to upper 80
s.  Creat/BUN up slightly this am.
   Action:
   Dopamine started and titrated up to 5mcg/kg/min.  CXR done.  Increased
   fio2 to 100% NRB.  Attempted face mask at 10 liters but O2 sats
   remained low. Given lasix 40mg at 6:45am
   Response:
   Bp increased to 100
s/30-40
s with maps mid to upper 50
s to low 60
   Urine output without significant increase with addition of dopamine.  ^
   O2 sats to mid 90
s on 100% NRB.
   Plan:
   Maintain maps in the 60
s.  Titrate down O2 when possible.  ? further
   iv lasix vs gtt
   Atrial flutter (Aflutter)
   Assessment:
   Conts to be in afib at rates of 40-50
s.  Requiring pacer at times.
   With addition of dopa rate increased to 60-70
s, rare pacer beat noted
   with dopa.  Heparin conts at 400 units/hr with therapeutic ptt.  RIJ
   with temp wire intact, set at rate 40.
   Action:
   Monitored temp wire/rhythm
   Response:
   Has remained in afib.
   Plan:
   ? electrical vs med cardioversion to ^ cardiac output.
   Urinary tract infection (UTI)
   Assessment:
   Patient with UTI. Patient also with some confusion per family members,
   patient is unclear where she is and the date, but knows who she is and
   all her family members. Remains pleasant.
   Action:
   Administered po cipro as ordered. Encouraged po intake and cranberry
   juice. Re-oriented by family prn.
   Response:
   Patient afebrile. Tolerating antibiotic. Patient continues with poor
   appetite, nutrition consulted and recommended boost to be delivered on
   tray with meals.
   Plan:
   Continue antibiotics as ordered. Continue to encourage nutritional
   status.
